creator.name: Vereniging Zendingsgenootschap der Evangelische Broedergemeente (EBG) te Zeist / Zeister Zendingsgenootschap (ZZG)
creator.name_english: Missionary Society of the Evangelical Brotherhood (EBH) Association in Zeist
creator.his_func:
The Missionary Society of the Evangelical Brotherhood (EBH) Association in Zeist, known as the "Zeister Zendingsgenootschap'' (ZZG), was founded in 1793. The aim was to support the missionary activities of the Evangelical Brotherhood centre in Herrnhut (Germany), in particular the missionary work in the Dutch colonies. By far the biggest efforts were expended in Suriname. The ZZG had a close relationship with the EBH community of Zeist itself, which was the main center of EBH activities in The Netherlands.

Its predecessor was the "Genootschap tot uitbreiding van het Evangelium onder de Heydenen", the Society for the expansion of the Gospel among the Heathen (Amsterdam 1737-1772).
creator.notes: See also the description of the record "ZZG" in the "Repertorium van Nederlandse zendings- en missie-archieven 1800-1960".
